text:
Smartsheet offers an enterprise
work management platform.

With AWS, some of the big
challenges we've solved
would be deployment frequency.

Over the last 12 months, we've
gone from weekly deployments

to deployments that we
do multiple times a day,
and from what used to be hours of,
like at least two engineers time.

We've been able to shave
that down to several minutes.
We chose to move to Fargate largely

because we saw the
success of the solution

when we applied it at
the company I was previously at

It offered a very good
level of abstraction
and finding a good level of

abstraction when you have a
T-shaped engineering structure
for your engineers is really important
because engineers are required
to be successful all across the stack.
We move over to ECS

and that's where, from there,
we can now just plug that in
with other managed services
and things like deployments just work,
or if we want to scale out

or specialize our services,
that is now something
that is very easy to solve.
Within the last year, we've been able
to scale out our capacity by 50x.

We recently adopted Graviton
in our Fargate deployments.

What we saw right away was
a 20% reduction of our cost.

With using managed services,
we can now start to ride on top
of what AWS already offers,

and so we can use their
security certification,

their compliance
certifications as a foundation,

eliminating a lot of what we
would've had to do ourselves.

We can now really focus
on the bigger picture

and what Smartsheet is
really trying to solve
for our customers.
